post.summary: Create a new delivery or pickup order.

label.description: A label that can be used to identify the order. This is shown in place of the externalId to the rider and the consumer.

quoteKey.description: If you are using the quote service then you must provide the quoteKey here

requireReadyEvent.description: If you will be triggering a call to `order/ready` then set this field to true.

contactFreeSpecialInstructions.description: Special instructions that will be shown to the rider when the order is marked as contact free

proof.description: Control the proof of delivery collected by the rider. It is not recommended that you require more than one POD as it can become bothersome to the consumer.

photo.description: Should the delivery rider collect a photo as proof of delivery

signature.description: Should the delivery rider collect a signature as proof of delivery

idScan.description: Should the delivery rider require an ID as proof of alcohol delivery

orderSourceKey.description: Optional source system of the order. orderSourceKey can be provided by relay.

discount.description: Always treated as negative. Only useful for cash orders or reporting purposes.

isFutureOrder.description: If this is a scheduled order. IE, non ASAP.

placed.description: The time the consumer placed the order.

lateDelivery.description: The time the consumer considers the order late.

expectedReady.description: The time at which the order is estimated to be ready for pickup

riderCount.description: Rarely used should be left unused 99% of the time. Enables multiple bicycle couriers. Cost is multipled per rider. For example, 4 riders at a $6 relay fee will actually cost $24. Should not be used without discussing your use case with the Relay team.

metadata.description: Include any metadata you would like to associate with the order.

simple-asap-delivery.description: Creates an order to be delivered ASAP.

simple-asap-delivery-with-photo-pod.description: Creates an order to be delivered ASAP and ask the delivery person to take a photo proof of delivery.

quoted-asap-delivery.description: This order is gauranteed to be accepted because a valid quoteKey is being provided. The relay fee from the quote will be provided.

items.name: Carrots
items.specialInstructions: Make sure not to overcook my carrots

200.description: OK - request was successfully evaluated, but the order was not accepted for delivery

example.message: Order not accepted. Provide a valid quoteKey or talk to your sales rep to get all your orders accepted.

201.description: OK - order created and accepted. Click here for more details on the 201 schema response.

metadata.description: This is a place to store any additional information about the order that is not covered by the other fields.

producerLocationType.description: A STATIC location is one that has an active restaurant users and those users can interact with/manage your order. A DYNAMIC restaurant has no users associated with it.

discount.description: Always treated as negative. Only useful for cash orders or reporting purposes.

400.description: Invalid request. See validationErrors for more details

409.description: Invalid configuration. Your account is not yet configured to accept orders.

example.message: Invalid configuration. Your account is not yet configured to accept orders.

patch.summary: Make changes to an active order.
patch.description: Some fields of the order may be updated. See /schemas/platform-order-update-request.html

tip.description: Decreases in tips are not supported.

expectedReady.description: The time at which the order is estimated to be ready for pickup

reason.description: Let us know why this order needs an update.

consumer.specialInstructions: I'll be in the attic. Call me when you get here.

value.reason: Customer service update. Customer got everything wrong.
Customer gave us the wrong phone number.

404.description: Order is not found or no longer avaiable for update.

get.description: Review order details and hooks. Polling this method is not expected. You should rely on the webhooks to recieve updates.

body.description: Schema will match the corresponding webhook event (see https://docs.relay.delivery/schemas/v2-order.html)

404.description: Order is not found or no longer avaiable.

metadata.description: Include any metadata you like. This will be associated any order created from this quote.

errorMessage.v2-quote-constraints: Can have either producer.constraints or consumer.constraints, but not both. ASAP orders should have no constraints.

200.description: OK - quote request was successfully evaluated, but relay is not offering a quote at this time.

201.description: OK - quote request was successfully evaluated and a quote has been created and returned

response.description: The expected seconds between delivery ready and rider arrival at the producer's location.

delivery.description: The expected seconds between delivery pickup and delivery arrival at the consumer's location.

400.description: Invalid request. See validationErrors for more details

409.description: Invalid configuration. Your account is not configured to accept quotes.

get.description: If you created a quote a in the past and you want to check if the quote is still valid then you can attempt to fetch it by the quote key. If the quote is no longer valid then it will not be found. If you are using your quotes right away then there is no need to call this route.

response.description: The expected seconds between delivery ready and rider arrival at the producer's location.

delivery.description: The expected seconds between delivery pickup and delivery arrival at the consumer's location.

get.summary: Retrieve the chatroom interface URL for a specific order
get.description: To chat with RELAY's support team, you can use the chatroom URL provided in the response. The chatroom URL is unique to each order.

metadata.description: This is a place to store any additional information about the order that is not covered by the other fields.

producerLocationType.description: A STATIC location is one that has an active restaurant users and those users can interact with/manage your order. A DYNAMIC restaurant has no users associated with it.

discount.description: Always treated as negative. Only useful for cash orders or reporting purposes.

body.description: Schema will match the corresponding webhook event (see https://docs.relay.delivery/schemas/v2-order.html)

404.description: Chatroom interface is not found or no longer avaiable.

post.summary: Retrieve the delivery zone for any address
post.description: Relay's maximum possible operating zone for a specific address. Orders outside of this range will never be accepted.

200.description: OK - request was successfully evaluated. A delivery zone is returned if we service the address and no delivery zone is returned if the address is outside of Relay's operating area.

schema.description: No delivery zone will be returned if the provided address is outside Relay's operating area.

400.description: Invalid request. See validationErrors for more details

post.summary: Toggle the ready status of an order.
post.description: If you have an event for when an order is ready to be picked up then you can use this route to dramatically improve the quality of service your orders receive on the Relay Platform. Be sure to set `requireReadyEvent` to true when creating the order if you intend to use this method.
Cancel an order when a customer no longer wants an order. Voiding an order should be extremely rare and excessive voiding is treated as abuse.

200.description: OK. Order voided or was already voided.

409.description: The order can no longer be voided
